verses.verse: בְּ֭נִי <WH1121> Be-ni My son לְחָכְמָתִ֣י <WH2451> le-cha-che-ma-Ti unto my wisdom הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה <WH7181> hak-Shi-vah; attend לִ֝תְבוּנָתִ֗י <WH8394> lit-vu-na-Ti, to my understanding הַט־ <WH5186> hat- [and] bow אָזְנֶֽךָ׃ <WH241> 'a-ze-Ne-cha. thine ear

לִשְׁמֹ֥ר <WH8104> lish-Mor That thou mayest regard מְזִמּ֑וֹת <WH4209> me-zim-Mot; discretion וְ֝דַ֗עַת <WH1847> ve-Da-'at, knowledge שְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ <WH8193> se-fa-Tei-cha and [that] thy lips יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃ <WH5341> yin-Tzo-ru. may keep

כִּ֤י <WH3588> ki for נֹ֣פֶת <WH5317> No-fet [as] an honeycomb תִּ֭טֹּפְנָה <WH5197> Tit-to-fe-nah drop שִׂפְתֵ֣י <WH8193> sif-Tei For the lips זָרָ֑ה <WH2114> za-Rah; of a strange woman וְחָלָ֖ק <WH2509> ve-cha-Lak [is] smoother מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן <WH8081> mish-She-men than oil חִכָּֽהּ׃ <WH2441> chik-Kah. and her mouth

וְֽ֭אַחֲרִיתָהּ <WH319> Ve-'a-cha-ri-tah But her end מָרָ֣ה <WH4751> ma-Rah is bitter כַֽלַּעֲנָ֑ה <WH3939> chal-la-'a-Nah; as wormwood חַ֝דָּ֗ה <WH2299> chad-Dah, sharp כְּחֶ֣רֶב <WH2719> ke-Che-rev sword פִּיּֽוֹת׃ <WH6310> pi-Yot. as a twoedged

רַ֭גְלֶיהָ <WH7272> Rag-lei-ha Her feet יֹרְד֣וֹת <WH3381> yo-re-Dot go down מָ֑וֶת <WH4194> Ma-vet; to death שְׁ֝א֗וֹל <WH7585> ol, on hell צְעָדֶ֥יהָ <WH6806> tze-'a-Dei-ha her steps יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃ <WH8551> yit-Mo-chu. take hold

אֹ֣רַח <WH734> 'O-rach the path חַ֭יִּים <WH2416> Chai-yim of life פֶּן־ <WH6435> pen- does not תְּפַלֵּ֑ס <WH6424> te-fal-Les; Lest thou shouldest ponder נָע֥וּ <WH5128> na-'U are moveable מַ֝עְגְּלֹתֶ֗יהָ <WH4570> ma'-ge-lo-Tei-ha, her ways לֹ֣א <WH3808> lo does not תֵדָֽע׃ <WH3045> te-Da'. [that] thou canst not know פ Peh

וְעַתָּ֣ה <WH6258> ve-'at-Tah Now בָ֭נִים <WH1121> Va-nim me now therefore O ye children שִׁמְעוּ־ <WH8085> shim-'u- Hear לִ֑י Li; וְאַל־ <WH408> ve-'al- not תָּ֝ס֗וּרוּ <WH5493> ta-Su-ru, and depart מֵאִמְרֵי־ <WH561> me-'im-rei- not from the words פִֽי׃ <WH6310> Fi. of my mouth

הַרְחֵ֣ק <WH7368> har-Chek far מֵעָלֶ֣יהָ <WH5921> me-'a-Lei-ha and דַרְכֶּ֑ךָ <WH1870> dar-Ke-cha; thy way וְאַל־ <WH408> ve-'al- not תִּ֝קְרַ֗ב <WH7126> tik-Rav, from her and come not nigh אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- about פֶּ֥תַח <WH6607> Pe-tach the door בֵּיתָֽהּ׃ <WH1004> bei-Tah. of her house

פֶּן־ <WH6435> pen- Or תִּתֵּ֣ן <WH5414> tit-Ten Lest thou give לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים <WH312> la-'a-che-Rim unto others הוֹדֶ֑ךָ <WH1935> ho-De-cha; thine honour וּ֝שְׁנֹתֶ֗יךָ <WH8141> u-she-no-Tei-cha, and thy years לְאַכְזָרִֽי׃ <WH394> le-'ach-za-Ri. unto the cruel

פֶּֽן־ <WH6435> pen- lest יִשְׂבְּע֣וּ <WH7646> yis-be-'U be filled זָרִ֣ים <WH2114> za-Rim Lest strangers כֹּחֶ֑ךָ <WH3581> ko-Che-cha; with thy wealth וַ֝עֲצָבֶ֗יךָ <WH6089> va-'a-tza-Vei-cha, and thy labours בְּבֵ֣ית <WH1004> be-Veit [be] in the house נָכְרִֽי׃ <WH5237> na-che-Ri. of a stranger

וְנָהַמְתָּ֥ <WH5098> ve-na-ham-Ta And thou mourn בְאַחֲרִיתֶ֑ךָ <WH319> ve-'a-cha-ri-Te-cha; at the last בִּכְל֥וֹת <WH3615> bich-Lot are consumed בְּ֝שָׂרְךָ֗ <WH1320> be-sa-re-cha, when thy flesh וּשְׁאֵרֶֽךָ׃ <WH7607> u-she-'e-Re-cha. and thy body

וְֽאָמַרְתָּ֗ <WH559> ve-'a-mar-Ta, And say אֵ֭יךְ <WH349> 'eich How שָׂנֵ֣אתִי <WH8130> sa-Ne-ti How have I hated מוּסָ֑ר <WH4148> mu-Sar; instruction וְ֝תוֹכַ֗חַת <WH8433> ve-to-Cha-chat, reproof נָאַ֥ץ <WH5006> na-'Atz despised לִבִּֽי׃ <WH3820> lib-Bi. and my heart

וְֽלֹא־ <WH3808> ve-lo-Sha- Nor שָׁ֭מַעְתִּי <WH8085> ma'-ti And have not obeyed בְּק֣וֹל <WH6963> be-Kol the voice מוֹרָ֑י <WH3384> mo-Rai; of my teachers וְ֝לִֽמְלַמְּדַ֗י <WH3925> ve-lim-lam-me-Dai, to them that instructed לֹא־ <WH3808> lo- Nor הִטִּ֥יתִי <WH5186> hit-Ti-ti nor inclined אָזְנִֽי׃ <WH241> 'a-ze-Ni. mine ear

כִּ֭מְעַט <WH4592> Kim-'at I was almost הָיִ֣יתִי <WH1961> ha-Yi-ti become בְכָל־ <WH3605> ve-chol- utter רָ֑ע <WH7451> Ra'; in all evil בְּת֖וֹךְ <WH8432> be-Toch in the midst קָהָ֣ל <WH6951> ka-Hal of the congregation וְעֵדָֽה׃ <WH5712> ve-'e-Dah. and assembly

שְׁתֵה־ <WH8354> she-teh- Drink מַ֥יִם <WH4325> Ma-yim waters מִבּוֹרֶ֑ךָ <WH953> mib-bo-Re-cha; out of thine own cistern וְ֝נֹזְלִ֗ים <WH5140> ve-no-ze-Lim, and running waters מִתּ֥וֹךְ <WH8432> mit-Toch out of בְּאֵרֶֽךָ׃ <WH875> be-'e-Re-cha. thine own well

יָפ֣וּצוּ <WH6327> ya-Fu-tzu be dispersed מַעְיְנֹתֶ֣יךָ <WH4599> ma'-ye-no-Tei-cha Let thy fountains ח֑וּצָה <WH2351> Chu-tzah; abroad בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת <WH7339> ba-re-cho-Vot, in the streets פַּלְגֵי־ <WH6388> pal-gei- [and] rivers מָֽיִם׃ <WH4325> Ma-yim. of waters

יִֽהְיוּ־ <WH1961> yih-yu- become לְךָ֥ le-Cha לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ <WH905> le-vad-De-cha; alone וְאֵ֖ין <WH369> ve-'Ein else לְזָרִ֣ים <WH2114> le-za-Rim Let them be only thine own and not strangers' אִתָּֽךְ׃ <WH854> 'it-Tach. for

יְהִֽי־ <WH1961> ye-hi- Let מְקוֹרְךָ֥ <WH4726> me-kor-Cha Let thy fountain בָר֑וּךְ <WH1288> va-Ruch; be blessed וּ֝שְׂמַ֗ח <WH8055> u-se-Mach, and rejoice מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת <WH802> me-'E-shet with the wife נְעוּרֶֽךָ׃ <WH5271> ne-'u-Re-cha. of thy youth

אַיֶּ֥לֶת <WH365> 'ai-Ye-let hind אֲהָבִ֗ים <WH158> 'a-ha-Vim, [Let her be as] the loving וְֽיַעֲלַ֫ת־ <WH3280> ve-ya-'a-Lat- roe חֵ֥ן <WH2580> chen and pleasant דַּ֭דֶּיהָ <WH1717> Dad-dei-ha let her breasts יְרַוֻּ֣ךָ <WH7301> ye-rav-Vu-cha satisfy בְכָל־ <WH3605> ve-chol- all עֵ֑ת <WH6256> 'Et; thee at all times בְּ֝אַהֲבָתָ֗הּ <WH160> be-'a-ha-va-Tah, with her love תִּשְׁגֶּ֥ה <WH7686> tish-Geh and be thou ravished תָמִֽיד׃ <WH8548> ta-Mid. always

וְלָ֤מָּה <WH4100> ve-Lam-mah why תִשְׁגֶּ֣ה <WH7686> tish-Geh be ravished בְנִ֣י <WH1121> ve-Ni And why wilt thou my son בְזָרָ֑ה <WH2114> ve-za-Rah; with a strange woman וּ֝תְחַבֵּ֗ק <WH2263> u-te-chab-Bek, and embrace חֵ֣ק <WH2436> chek the bosom נָכְרִיָּֽה׃ <WH5237> na-che-ri-Yah. alien

כִּ֤י <WH3588> ki for נֹ֨כַח׀ <WH5227> No-chach [are] before עֵינֵ֣י <WH5869> 'ei-Nei the eyes יְ֭הוָה <WH3069> Yah-weh God דַּרְכֵי־ <WH1870> dar-chei- For the ways אִ֑ישׁ <WH376> 'Ish; of man וְֽכָל־ <WH3605> ve-chol all מַעְגְּלֹתָ֥יו <WH4570> ma'-ge-lo-Tav all his goings מְפַלֵּֽס׃ <WH6424> me-fal-Les. and he pondereth

עַֽווֹנוֹתָ֗יו <WH5771> a-vo-no-Tav, His own iniquities יִלְכְּדֻנ֥וֹ <WH3920> yil-ke-du-No shall take אֶת־ <WH853> 'et- הָרָשָׁ֑ע <WH7563> ha-ra-Sha'; the wicked וּבְחַבְלֵ֥י <WH8551> u-ve-chav-Lei himself and he shall be holden חַ֝טָּאת֗וֹ <WH2403> chat-ta-To, of his sins יִתָּמֵֽךְ׃ <WH2256> yit-ta-Mech. with the cords

ה֗וּא <WH1931> Hu, He יָ֭מוּת <WH4191> Ya-mut He shall die בְּאֵ֣ין <WH369> be-'Ein lack מוּסָ֑ר <WH4148> mu-Sar; without instruction וּבְרֹ֖ב <WH7230> u-ve-Ro and in the greatness אִוַּלְתּ֣וֹ <WH200> iv-val-To of his folly יִשְׁגֶּֽה׃ <WH7686> yish-Geh. he shall go astray פ Peh
